channel.title: CVE Feed for F5 -- BIG-IP ASM
channel.description: The latest CVEs for F5 -- BIG-IP ASM

item.title: CVE-2019-6682|2024-08-04T20:31:03.619Z -- f5 -- big-ip%20asm
item.description: On versions 15.0.0-15.0.1.1, 14.0.0-14.1.2.2, 13.1.0-13.1.3.1, 12.1.0-12.1.5, and 11.5.2-11.6.5.1, the BIG-IP ASM system may consume excessive resources when processing certain types of HTTP responses from the origin web server. This vulnerability is only known to affect resource-constrained systems in which the security policy is configured with response-side features, such as Data Guard or response-side learning.

item.title: CVE-2019-6665|2024-08-04T20:31:02.519Z -- f5 -- big-ip%20asm
item.description: On BIG-IP ASM 15.0.0-15.0.1, 14.1.0-14.1.2, 14.0.0-14.0.1, and 13.1.0-13.1.3.1, BIG-IQ 6.0.0 and 5.2.0-5.4.0, iWorkflow 2.3.0, and Enterprise Manager 3.1.1, an attacker with access to the device communication between the BIG-IP ASM Central Policy Builder and the BIG-IQ/Enterprise Manager/F5 iWorkflow will be able to set up the proxy the same way and intercept the traffic.

item.title: CVE-2019-6687|2024-08-04T20:31:04.201Z -- f5 -- big-ip%20asm
item.description: On versions 15.0.0-15.0.1.1, the BIG-IP ASM Cloud Security Services profile uses a built-in verification mechanism that fails to properly authenticate the X.509 certificate of remote endpoints.
